private_information: I am the left peg and currently hold disks from top to bottom: A B C D E F G H
I can only move the top disk if it is not placed on a smaller disk
peg_left.goal: Provide a clear local description of my initial stack and allowable local moves to help build a complete planning model for moving all disks to the right peg

private_information: I am the middle peg and currently empty
I can receive or send the top disk subject to global movement rules
peg_middle.goal: Provide a clear local description of my initial stack (empty) and allowable local moves to help build a complete planning model for moving all disks to the right peg

private_information: I am the right peg and currently empty
I will be the target peg for the final configuration
peg_right.goal: Provide a clear local description of my initial stack (empty) and allowable local moves to help build a complete planning model for moving all disks to the right peg

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the peg agents' local descriptions and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right
There are eight disks labeled A B C D E F G H from smallest (A) to largest (H)
Only one disk can be moved at a time and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H; middle peg empty; right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg empty; middle peg empty; right peg has top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H
Moves consist of taking the top disk from one peg and placing it on top of another peg if legal

model.system_prompt: You represent the left peg in the Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a concise machine-readable description of the peg local state, listing disks top-to-bottom, the identity of the top disk, and the local move actions you can perform in the form move-top-to target_peg. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on accuracy and include any constraints relevant to this peg.
model.prompt: Your name is peg_left. Use public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->peg_left->private_information} to produce a structured description of your initial stack, the top disk, and the allowed local move actions and constraints. Do not emit PDDL. Return a clear machine-readable summary that the orchestrator can consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating the peg agents' local summaries and producing a complete multi-agent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain models disks, pegs, the legal move action (moving the top disk between pegs with the constraint that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller one), and any necessary predicates for the initial and goal states. The PDDL must be fully specified and ready for FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the inputs from the peg agents: {peg_left_model}, {peg_middle_model}, {peg_right_model}. Use public information {environment->public_information}. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem ready for FastDownwards that solves the instance where all disks move from left to right while obeying the Tower of Hanoi rules. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Keep agent-origin of constraints clear if relevant.
